comment:
The judge ruled Johnny Depp assaulted Amber Heard on 12 different occasions and put her in actual fear for her very life on 3 different occasions. In a court of law he IS considered a wife beater and the Sun is perfectly in the right to call him so. 

Our dude is greasy. He needs to take a gd shower and go to rehab before he dies from $30k a month worth of wine, pills, ecstacy and cocaine. He "seems awkward in public" because he's intoxicated. Drugged and drunk to the very extent to which the human body can withstand. You'd be awkward too if you had, "been awake 3 days snorting powder, pills, wine, 2 bottles of champers on the plane..", probably the same plane he admits to attempting to "playfully tap" kick Amber on the ass during an argument as she was walking away. 

Can you imagine if your husband tried to kick you during an argument as you were walking away?! The witnesses to the event said that Amber continued to walk off crying. If that was me I would have wrecked that entire plane into the ground to get to his wasted ass if my husband was as disrespctful of me, his life partner, as JD was of his wife and life partner, AH. 

All these JD ass kissing videos with lies about amber and the case clickbait that I've watched never bring up the fact that Amber only started recording the things he did because the next day when she had to tell him what he did and said and how much it sucked for her when he was black out wasted, he couldn't remember anything! 

There's probably a reason JD couldn't get Vanessa to marry him. He's a disaster, a walking drug overdose. The last person that can be a good husband. Ladies that have been in a marriage with someone that was constantly drunk and drugged, was it a decent marriage? Was he a decent, competent husband or was he very sick, toxic to his marriage and to you, and need psychiatric care? Did you feel more like a babysitter than a wife? JD needs to go straight from the courtroom to his room in a rehab in my opinion, and I'm sure many psychiatrist's opinions are well.

Smfh...."$30k a month on 'wine'". Btw, to deny to himself how big a problem he has, he claims the wines he buys are "investments". His accountants counter that, "it's not an investment if you drink it as soon as you buy it." ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è He's really gone downhill. I know he was always a drug addict and an alcoholic, but now that he's 60 it's really starting to show. I don't think he's gonna live much longer abusing drugs and alcohol to the extent he does...he's pushing 60 partying like a 24 year old. 

Shame. HUGE shame, he is one of my favorite actors and I don't believe in enabling and letting people remain in denial about their substance abuse disorder until it kills them. Why doesn't Vanessa and or his daughter and son stage an intervention for their Father, or the father of their children??! Will he rough them up too if they said something like what he did to A when she tried to intervene? Ignoring this will not make this go away, but it will make him go away. Forever. This is how people die. He needs to address this issue. His family needs to take him for a 9 month in patient stay at Betty Ford. No more going to the Bahamas to his private island to "dry out" he needs to be in an actual rehab that uses intensive therapy all day and mental health medication, therefore he has to have doctors and he needs to stay inpatient for at least 6 to 9 months. No jumping over the fence after less than a day and going home and doing an huge shot to the arm and then a shot in the head like kurt. We've seen this happen to all of our heroes. We cant let it happen AGAIN to JD!

comment: The way Amber tells her alleged abuse story seemed fake to me the very first time I saw it. It doesn't take a body language analyst to tell that her behaviour wasn't natural. Even abuse victims don't speak about hurtful situations in that overly emotional kind of way. Moreover I used to act in that same theatrical way when I got caught lying to my mother in distant past. If you remember how you yourself behaved trying to fake a story & lie you spot a liar easily knowing that's exactly what you'd do as a bad liar. Only I sucked at lying when I was a child and she sucks at lying as a hollywood actress, who's supposed to get paid for lying :0. Obvious compensation of lack of credibility & consistency. I tried to imagine what would my natural behaviour in a situation such as a court trial be if i were a victim of physical abuse. I thought that I'd either not express too much emotion being frozen, or cry when recalling a hurtful memory but it's either one, or the other & she really seems to be confused about the emotion she should show neither frozen nor authentically expressing feelings. The fact most people don't feel comfortable expressing vulnerability in public situations such as court processes also leads me to believe that if anyone felt the urge to cry he'd try to hold back the tears, or make a pause in speaking until he can calm down so that his voice doesn't break that much, so she overdone the whole thing.

comment: This is just so embarrassing and disgusting. As a true victim of abuse I can not relate to Amber‚Äôs testimony watsoever. When I testified I couldn‚Äôt contain my emotions. Each question asked by attorneys caused me to relive my painful experiences. I automatically and subconsciously went into great detail as I described the abuse, showing painful emotion as I couldn‚Äôt control it. When you‚Äôre describing  a very painful memory you sadly and vividly remember most every detail. Your body language is nothing like Amber‚Äôs was here. Setting aside the opinion of the body language expert in this video, I myself came to the conclusion she was only acting before even listening to the expert analyze her disposition. It‚Äôs just very saddening and extremely degrading to true domestic victims üò™. Also, why is it Johnny depp has physical proof of losing a fingertip due to her abuse, yet she doesn‚Äôt have injuries that severe? She‚Äôs very obviously the manipulator in this relationship. And the abuser. Not saying he‚Äôs totally innocent. But she‚Äôs most definitely exaggerating his role and pretending she‚Äôs a victim just to win her case and destroy his career. She herself said nobody will believe him against her. And she very sadly appeared to be right. As he lost all his acting jobs while she kept hers. Her ex girlfriend said Amber was abusing towards her as well. While Jonny Depp‚Äôs exes of many many years said he was never once physical with them. That tells a lot. I wish people could understand that woman are just as capable of being the manipulative abusers, as much so as men. She was already caught lying, claiming she donated the 7 million Depp gave her in the divorce in 2016  ( in hopes it would prove she wasn‚Äôt bashing him to gain his money). When in reality til this day in 2021, she still hasn‚Äôt donated the 7 million. She straight out lied in an interview. So easily and blatantly lied about something as serious as charity. If she can so easily lie about that, what else can she lie about? The lady is only after men for their money. Which is why Elon musk was her next target (cheating with him while her and Depp were still married). He‚Äôs the richest man in the world. Come on people. Pay attention to her behavior. If only the judge would do the same without fear of dismissing domestic abuse charges of a celebrity female. The judge is only scared of the backlash he‚Äôd get for ruling against a female. It‚Äôs that simple

comment:
I suffered from emotional and sexual abuse in my relationship. I coped by dissociating. This means that my recollection isn't the best. That being said, what happened still remains clear and I can explain what happened and the details I do remember without stuttering, without having to think too much. If I do stop, it's normally because I'm about to say something that hurts to admit to myself. Hurts to remember and accept as part of my past, not because I can't remember the details.

I know sometimes things can happened so fast that you don't realise what was going on and how it happened but that doesn't change how you felt in the situation. The details aren't important when you're sharing your experience, it's the authenticity and congruency.

comment: My ex was the same exact way. When she was mad at me for threatening to call the police because she broke a plate on my head, the next morning I went to walk the dog and came back to a locked door and I didn't have my keys or phone. She was in the window taunting me. I was knocking on the door. She had made me upset at this point so I'm knocking hard on the security door and was going to be late for work. As I'm knocking at the door two PD officers show up and put me in cuffs. I sat on the curb. She had called the cops while I was out of the house, lied and said I hit her, put on makeup to look like a bruise on her cheek. They bought her story over mine. I went to jail. The cops took pics of her fake bruise without a question that day. Two days later my sister was there to pick up my stuff and she had obviously washed off the " bruise" . my sister got a video of the whole encounter and what she told my sister was completely different than what she told the police and my sister asked where the bruise went and she responded with, omg it's not there?... I guess I heal really fast" . this video and my calling the police for an escort 3 days later (same cops) helped my charges get dropped.

Wow. What a SURVIVOR!
Aside from a beating that doesn't kill, what else do people survive?
Attempted Murder (stabbing, shooting, strangulation, blunt force trauma, poison) 
Diseases/Terminal Conditions: Cancer, AIDS, Brain Tumor, Heart Attack (this list is too long for me to fill) 
Natural Disasters (tornado, earthquake, hurricane, typhoon, flood, volcano) 
Freak Accidents (car/train/plane accidents, collapsed buildings, gaping floors, stray bullets)
Invasive War (refugees fleeing embattled nations, evading gunfire and explosions while staving off starvation)

comment:
OK, I believe Herd is guilty, but I wonder if this body language styff could be misused, for example an abuse victim recalling what happened and being stressed because it was a stressful situation, and that stress shown being interpreted as lying. I am also wondering if this is reliable, why we aren't seeing body language interpreters being called as expert witnesses more often?
     I ask this because I have been accused of lying when telling the truth before and told a normal person wouldn't react that way.  Well I have a different personality and history from everyone else on the planet. It reminds me of how people are often told they don't act like a typical victim of whatever crime, and  that sort of testimony by police officers and others is often barred from courtrooms in the cases of sexual assault.

comment: Wow. When I had to give testimony against my husband for my own protection it started a little rough. I couldn't breath. I couldn't remember my mother's address. He was sitting less than three feet away from me across a table and looking in my eyes. When I calmed down I was able to convey my memories accurately and with emotions that I fought to keep at bay. This man had held a gun to my head, threatened my life and chased me across the entire east side of our city before waiting for me at a medical facility he knew I would need to be at within the hour. All to continue the harassing behavior I had dealt with for years. This is a disgusting travesty and makes light of REAL victims and the process we must go through in order to receive protection for legitimate abuse and death threats from the men we have been trying to get away from with our lives. This culture is deplorable. The same bullsh*t that enables stupid c*nts like this to make light of our pain and the courage needed to escape abuse has stripped employment, a voice and legal culpability from the true victim in this situation. All because he's a man and she's a no talent, violent, unfaithful loser with a vagina. I'd call her a woman, but we don't want her. Thank you, @AmberHeard for making a joke out of the most frightening situation in my life and the courage it took to face my abuser in a court of law. Anyone that gives a job to or supports this ABUSER should get exactly what they deserve. That is the same disdain and cancellation received by public figures every day for so much less because they have the gaul and absolute shame to be real people in this sick time we live in. The world has gone f*cking crazy. Thanks for reading and peace out. üò°

comment:
I've been in a relationship with someone this toxic..

I will never forget when my ex (year long relationship) accused me of cheating when I'd didn't. At 24 years old I was working every day and night to pay the bills and was getting 3 hours of sleep every night from working 3 jobs. She was going to school and living off of my income. I got tired of it and I said "if you're going to falsely accuse me of always cheating than I might as well do it anyways".

She pulled a knife on me in my own kitchen and told me I wouldn't live to tell the story. She even asked me "even if I was to stab you in 'self defense' who do you think the cops would believe you as a man or me?". She even started fake crying with a knife pointed at my stomach while I was doing dishes and started talking to me as if she was speaking to cops afterwards.. saying things  in a sobbing voice like "he was coming at me and I didn't know what to do".

I then planned my escape that weekend afterwards, and moved out.. bought a gun (carry it on me 24/7) and have never looked back. But all I remember thinking all the time is there's women out there who are this crazy, abusive and hide that they think this way. They will hurt or threaten anyone to get what they want.

Still to this day my current wife tells me I have issues trusting people (like friends and family). We even reflected and it took me about a year or two to properly fall asleep overnight in the same bed together since we've started. I always tell her you would too after what I've dealt with.

comment: In a deposition, even if the objectons seems irrelevant or bogus, its to reserve the right to make an objection during the actual trial. If the lawyer doesent make an objection to a certain question during the deposition, they lose the right to object to that same question during the trial. This means that depending on the response from the lawyers client. They can object during the trial in hopes of that answer not coming out during trial.

comment: Soooooo.... I feel a need to mention a concern I have regarding body language analysis in a deposition setting. Is there any specific way to spot the difference between the fidgeting and discomfort of a person with an anxiety disorder, autism,  or schizophrenia versus actual dishonesty?  I realize that Amber Heard is totally ful of shit. But I can't help but notice a lot of the lie indicators she displayed are the same as the ticks I get from the anxiety of normal social interaction and in a deposition environment with absolutely nothing to hide or worry about someone with a disorder would be incredibly physically uncomfortable and nervous and exhibiting many of the same subconscious physically comforting ticks that i noticed in video...  My diagnosis is "schizoaffective borderline personality disorder"  I feel concerned at how easily a prosecutor who only cares about their conviction rate could prey on the mentally ill...

comment: a similiar thing happened to my father and his wife (not my mom). everyone in the family knew she was an abuser and a generally bad person but my dad stayed with her anyway. my dad regularly came to my house at night because he couldnt stay home or because she got violent. unfortunately they had a baby and the situation just worsened. When my dad filed for divorce she accused him for physical and sexual assault, which is taken extremely seriously. towards the end of their relationship my dad recorded several incidents where it clearly shows that his wife abused him and even sometimes their 2 years old son. he had whatsapp chats, voice recordings and neighbor  testimonies confirming that they've seen the wife hitting the child in public. we all thought that her allegations wont mean anything and that my dad will get at least partial custody of his son. but somehow not only did she get full custody of the child, but also my dad will never be able to see his son (not until the boy is 18 and can decide for himself). when i helped him through the case, watched every deposition and read all the scripts, i was really astonished ... the overwhelming evidence against this woman, and the lack of any evidence on him. i couldnt understand how could they conclude that he was the abuser. some of the hearings were laughable, the woman would just start screaming and fake crying in an attempt to show the court how scared she is of him, to the point where he couldnt even be in his own hearing. usually am not the type to use race in an argument, i think its cheap and a hail mary attempt to salvage a lost argument. but if u look at my name u can figure out am middle eastern, and so is my dad ofc. I have no choice left but to think thats the reason he lost his case, because he is an ARAB and a MAN, while she is a European woman. but hey what do i know, i just feel bad for my dad.

comment:
There are people in the comment section who still refuse to believe that Amber Heard is the sole abuser, and she and Depp abused each other. They said because ‚ÄòDepp admitted to headbutted her‚Äô and a text message from Stephen Deuters (who work for Depp and present at the ‚ÄòBoston plane incident 2014‚Äô) to Amber that said that when he (Stephen) told Johnny that he kicked Amber, Johnny cried afterwards. I will counter that claims.

If you follow the court transcripts, those things above were brought to the trial and we heard what were actually happened and how Amber contradicted herself. The headbutt was accidental, happened when Amber was attacking Johnny and he tried to stop her hand motions and accidentally bumping head during the process.

Now, Amber claimed that she suffered the headbutt as part of series of violent assault during 15 December 2015. She said that besides the headbutt, Johnny caused her bloody, broken nose, split her lip, gave her black eyes, pulled part of her hair off (it was ‚Äòpusey‚Äô after several hours she said) while she provided a picture of chucks of blonde hair without any roots.

But there are no medical record about this despite her being an actress thus facial appearance is her money maker. And guess what, she attended James Corden Show the next day (you can YouTube the interview, the one about her and her ‚Äòballet claws‚Äô) without any injuries, not even a swollen face. She said it was a makeup magic but no makeup can covered broken nose, swollen face and split lip without intensive procedure that basically alter someone‚Äôs face.

I think this is actually help Johnny‚Äôs integrity because he actually admitted things that happened even if it could be twisted against him, but Amber lied, lied, lied and making things up.


About the ‚Äòkicking‚Äô text, Stephen Deuters actually defended Depp in court. At the plane during the incident, Amber get off of her seat and Johnny made a playful kicking motion without actually touch her. Amber caught this motion with her eyes and scream bloody murder. She tried to gaslight people who were present that Johnny kicked her and caused commotion. So, Johnny walked off to the bathroom and sleep there. Stephen admitted that when he had the text conversation with Amber, he just played along and agreed that Johnny kicked her to not angered her so she stopped bothering him.

Of course, Amber couldn‚Äôt help it, she embellished the story about the kicking. She said how tormented she was, how Johnny violently attacked her, how Johnny threw ice cubes at her and kicked the plane seat off (it ‚Äò‚Äòswivelled round‚Äù, with one kick) to her. Which she never mentioned in those text messages, and sounds very ridiculous because plane seats are bolted down. So, did Johnny kicked her directly or kicked a chair to her? She couldn‚Äôt stick to a story.

If you read the court transcripts, don‚Äôt be surprised if Amber basically created some fiction to the point is sounded like Hollywood movie script. She also always exaggerated Johnny‚Äôs physique, called him twice her size, ‚Äòbig man‚Äô, even though Depp known for not being a big or tall man. He never bulked up for a role and doesn‚Äôt played a brute in action movies either because he doesn‚Äôt look the part nor believable. And if you see their picture together, Amber almost as tall and (sometimes) close to his weight, without heels.

Depp apparently have superhuman strength, according to her. He can broke a bed frame by the pressure of his boot, broke a door, kick a bolted down plane chair off with a single kick, dragged her by hair for hours to various rooms, able to pull her hair so hard they weren‚Äôt pulled out to the roots but broke in the middle of length, etc.

She‚Äôs lunatic.

comment:
I remember when this case come up for the first time, and I had I very long discussion with a friend on the topic that it was too easy to make up a story of agression against Johnny if you just make a little digging in the internet.
I said, I don't believe in her not because I don't trust on her, but because it was (for me) clearly a setting up based on very past events. 25 years ago, more or less, Depp was impulsive and all fans know about it,  destroying rooms was his speciallity. 
Winona and Kate stories are in the internet, but never with physical agression (not saying that he was right), but there's a difference, huge difference of smacking things against the wall with no one there, and throwing at someones direction. Something that he never did, at least no one complaint about it. Far after,  these episodes,  he met Vanessa and according to her,  never had that kind of situation in their relationship. I think, He was mature, learned about behavior and lived like this way for so long. How could he wake up all those years later in this pure anger that Amber describes out of nowhere? I don't know, I just smelled something wrong.
I just hope he recovers quickly after this chapter. Wish you the best Johnny üôÇ.

comment: The attorney adding his objection for the record is a completely normal part of a deposition.  You comment on it right out of the gate and a second time but it‚Äôs normal.  The objection is stated for the record so that if the attorney asks the question and wants to us the answer in court the objection gets to be heard and ruled on by the judge.  If the objection is upheld then the answer is not read from the deposition.

comment: The YouTube channel LiveAbuseFree, if I remember its title correctly,  ( I can say as a woman who hates seeing men abuse women,) COMPLETELY exposes Amber's lies.  The lies are told on long, (tedious to listen to but still compelling) tape recordings of all the hogwash conversations she dragged poor Johnny through.  She was pretending she married him for love and she pretended she was trying to make the marriage work out in these recorded talk "therapy" conversations.  My personal opinion is, she saw an older man worth many millions of dollars whom she could ensnare with her youthful body and beauty to marry her without being convincingly, genuinely loving, while planning to divorce him soon and claim he abused her so she'd win more money in a divorce settlement.  He was easy to dupe because of his alcoholism and typical "thinking" with a certain type of motive that his gender's known for, (and a very limited degree of emotional vulnerability to her.)  The Truth turned the tables on her after she picked physically violent fights with him, by her trying to speed up her plans.  The tape recordings made her panic during the divorce process, so she pretended to the media that she was a martyr, a saintlike, suffering, delicate flower, and that she was donating to Charity the millions she finally pried out of the fiascolike, so called marriage in a settlement.  I, along with many others, severely doubt she did donate the settlement money as she claimed, not as of today's date!  If low comprehension media people and often mental illness rewarding Hollywood executives will help her acquire millions more through acting roles, I can see her MAYBE donating these millions in the FUTURE to cover her lies, and I can see her getting false witnesses to forge proof of this FUTURE deed as if it happened at the time of the divorce.  But I doubt even this will happen, because even as she thanked her so called fans for their support in the video above, here, well, as she departed from them they boo'd her very LOUDLY because of her slimy, lying nature.  She IS a narcissist, and if she makes good at a Hollywood career and makes millions more, I'll be shocked that she acquired loyal fans!  I wish she could be prosecuted and sent to prison for at least 15 years, a prison for pampered princess celebrities, (as many others vaguely wish, I'm sure.)  As it IS, she should tell her lawyers she's folding and to make a financial settlement with Depp's lawyers, and should SINCERELY apologize for lying and keep her lying mouth shut for the rest of her lying LIFE, and I mean till the day she dies.  I KNEW someone like her.  When women like her die, it's hard to find normal types of grieving going on.  It's more like when the munchkins sang, "Ding dong, the witch is dead" or when Hillary didn't win, and STILL won't shut up like everyone, even those who wept at the time of her losing, desperately WISHES she'd just finally shut up her lying mouth, and KEEP it shut till she dies.  Narcissists are HARD to put up with;  they're such LIARS, who just canNOT be told to STOP the lies.  The only thing to do is ESCAPE them.  So YAAY for Mr. Depp, now get your butt Johnny to AA.

She is in court, she should have gone over her story multiple times before going in. I mean if she even wants people to believe her story she should know it! I had a concussion when it happened to me, I had a new found stutter, and my memory was fuzzy, but I knew exactly what had happened and how. She was all over the place with her story telling, like she didn't even remember what happened. I am normally never one to say that the victim is lying, but her body language and the way she's talking in general just scream that she is.

author: raiden stark

comment:
Derek, I want you to know that you got the right conclusion, but you're misinterpreting, or leaving out some of her physical responses, you fail to mention how irritated and passive aggressive she is when being questioned. She isn't just simply nervous, she is irritated, annoyed, and holds contempt for the interviewer and even the court itself. At the beginning, I think you misinterpreted her licking her lip: In reality she was giving a soft raspberry to the speaker.

Aggression: her face turns red as she is describing a phone being thrown, the way she tenses her body, and simulates throwing, as if SHE were throwing it. She hints at a lack of emotional control when speaking about her sister supposedly being pushed by Johnny: her body shows a tensed stance, she has reddened cheeks, and her eyes are "squinting" not because she is "scared" but because she feels intense and unstable emotion. 
There is also a lot of aggression in the way she speaks, including her vernacular and her phrases. She says things like: "I didn't want to be a doormat." And, calls Johnny, a "whiny Baby." in the recording. That he always "runs away." This is the type of language that bullies use to justify beating up their victims. I don't know how you completely miss this or misinterpret her actions as simply "nervousness from lying." 

When she ate the piece of chocolate, she wasn't just doing it to buy time, she was doing it to be impolite, and the way she wagged her finger as though she had an "idea" come up for her response, that was all mockery and her way of saying: "This is case is a joke, and so is everyone in this room, I'll answer your question when I feel like it." 

Another example, when the interviewer asked if she understood her question, she muttered: "No." under her breath, then "Yes" when asked to clarify. This has less to do with lying, and more to do with Amber showing derision and asserting her dominance on everyone in the room. 

I also believe that she intentionally tried to freak out even her own lawyer because she starts off with: "I hit Johnny Depp because..." 
The lawyer immediately applied pressure to her arm, and started chastising her for "speaking softly." which was pure bullshit. In actuality, he was trying to tell her: "Hey, stop messing around. You know you aren't supposed to admit that you hit Johnny, its not funny, stop it." That is why her lawyer was getting frustrated at her. 
To further that point, She even had a smile on for a few seconds after admitting to hitting Johnny Depp, starting at about 10:49 after she saw how riled the court got when she said that. To her, this is all just a big joke. She doesn't respect other people, not even her own attorney. 

As for nervousness, It was there when she was trying to lie. But she certainly wasn't sweating in fear.. Some people would call her a narcissist. She could be. But I do know that her body language shows aggression, dominance, irritation, and smugness, not really nervousness.
author: War Pigs

Sometimes I pick up things from her vernacular, and at times sounds like she's interpreting Johnny Depp's kindness as a weakness and attributing it to him being a pushover. A lot of bullies use this kind of language and tout these sayings to justify their actions, to them, they believe that "might makes right."

comment:
I cant imagine how hard it must've been for Johnny. It doesn't matter if its a male victim or female victim no one deserves living with an abuser. I lived 5 years with a stepfather who used any excuse to insult me, scream at me, blame me for every bad thing that happend to him and treat me like shit when I was a child, I was terrified at the point that I spent all day in my room (except when I was at school) I didnt enjoy my late childhood, I didnt invite friends home, I didn't enjoy "my family" I dont have any good memory of those years. 
I didnt had friends or any support, and my mom didnt know what to do basically cause he abused her too. We got out of there a year ago but right now (15) Im still struggling with social anxiety and severe depression. NO ONE deserves that.

comment:
I'm no expert.. but she seems like the type of sociopath that is able to convince herself that she is innocent no matter how illogical her reasoning is.

The deadness in her eyes doesn't seem to be from the overwhelming mental exhaustion one would feel from having been a victim of violence. Instead, her overall demeanor reminds me of Morgan Geyser(from the 'slenderman stabbing' case) during her police interrogation. Also, her complacent behavior later on(the smirking, the rolling of the eyes) seems similar to that of Ted Bundy during his trials.

I am in now way personally affiliated with Amber Heard, but, as a victim of domestic abuse as well as a victim of abuse inflicted by partners in past relationships, I thought I'd contribute my two cents.

author: Vincent Gonzalez

comment:
Hi,
I think a good portion of your analysis is spot on, such as the micro expressions you point out.

There is one error in your analysis that I want to share: your criticism of last tense/present tense. Traumatized people frequently **do** shift tenses while recounting events. This is a result of neurological elements of how memory is stored and retrieved, especially as relates to narrative memory versus trauma memory. 

Overall, I agree that in the video, her portrayal is not very compelling.

comment: I've avoided any of the gossip, absolutely anything to do with this divorce because it's private stuff, so I've just not gone there.  I grew up with Johnny Depp, and while you couldn't pay me to watch the pirate movies, he's also a great actor and seems like a decent guy who just has a thing for scrawny women. Just sayin.  I also noticed Johnny keeping his business private, and again, that says a lot.  My brother's first wife was ALSO batshit crazy, and I recognize this performance.  I got a call from my brother saying Satan (my pet name for her. she put her kids through  9 kinds of hell, including boyfriends verbal and physical abuse of my niece, and the sexual abuse of my nephew, so, yeah, she earned the name) had hit him in the face with a pot, and taken the kids and left.  I took him to the ER to make sure his nose wasn't broken and called the police.  I'm the oldest. My brother never hit me as kids, and I provoked the hell out of all my brothers.  I was outnumbered. I had to rule by fear before it dawned on them the 3 of them might be able to take me.  Ultimately we pooled our money and offered her a one time cash payment and Satan signed over custody of the kids she didn't want and never deserved.  So Amber triggered me today. Little bit.  Batshit crazy.  Holy shit.  How the hell do you end up married to THAT? Can you imagine being some make up artist or anyone on the set that isn't the director or her co-star?  She'd make the worst Karens in internet history look sane in comparison.  There is always a lot of shame around abuse in a relationship, as well as when you know your spouse has cheated on you, and since I've had that experience maybe I'm over-empathizing with Depp.  Whatever it is, he's got my admiration because I'd like to slap the shit out of her just watching this.  She is a vindictive, bat-shit crazy, awful person who tried to ruin a man's career because he wouldn't stay in the same room while she lobbed cookware at him, and now she's going after his money, which is grotesque when she went into the marriage with a career and money and her marriage to Depp benefited her bank account even more.  I've got a feeling the more of this that gets out, the more of those people who hadn't followed the break up gossip will here the truth and she won't be able to buy an audience.  Also, a side note -- women who lie about abuse are despicable.  Read the statistics on domestic violence some time.  A guy not wanting to be in the same room with you isn't considered abuse.   BAT  SHIT

comment: She is clearly lying, I was in a mentally abusive relationship for 2 years, the last day we were together he became physical, he kicked me off the couch onto the floor, I got up went into the bedroom, he followed me,  punched me in the face, grabbed me by my hair pulled me to the ground started kicking me, the stood on me one foot on my head. All of this in front of my 4yr old daughter this was in 1991, and I still clearly remember everything like it was yesterday. Amber is trying to  find words to make up her story, and she's unsure if he was hitting her face or just moving it around, she seems like she can't remember what went on. She continuously shoves food in her mouth to prevent answering questions, or her lawyer is trying to delay her answers so she has more time to think of what she's saying. If it truly happened she wouldn't need time to think it would just flow and with emotion, which there is none, the few times she try's to add emotion there are no tears, and she actually stops emotion when she's figured out what to say. Thing is with being an actor how is she so unprepared to answer these questions? Even lawyers are supposed to go over scenarios and ask her questions and prepare her answers. Yet, she looks so unprepared, and the snack she brought seems to be used to delay answers, infact I've never seen someone eat during any kind of court testimony.

comment: I am a victim of domestic abuse, one of the hardest things I had  to do is testify about it in front strangers. Physical fights can become very disorienting, when you are being thrown around and especially if you get hit in the head hard enough. This disorientation does not last though. You DO remember everything, it just  takes a day or two to put everything back in the right order. First of all, she said she got hit under the eye with a vase, please, this is not an area on your head which causes disorientation. Secondly, recalling a traumatic event as a beating, always made me cry. I couldn't control it and believe me I tried. For embarrassment's sake alone. Crying in front of strangers is humiliating. Being beaten is humiliating. That is why a lot of victims don't come forward and the abusers get away with it. She should be ashamed of herself. If I were Johnny, I wouldn't do anything, his name is cleared he may be monetarily compensated and should relieved and be happy he didn't wake up with a 45 shoved in his mouth one morning. That bitch is crazy.

comment: You mentioned a few times that she is an actress and should be able to get her story across. The point is: acting in movies is different than being live on stage/ lying. If someone messes up the scene, you can't just redo the scene as often as you like. If you mess up your prepared story (for example because you forgot the emotion) you have to improvise. That's hard (even without the pressure of oath) and people will notice it, if that happens. The fact that if you mess up, the others will notice it (because the story isn't that fluid anymore, etc) adds a lot of pressure. The more pressure is on you, the more likely you are to actually mess up.

author: intan J

comment:
Listen, I think it's unfair to attach these self soothing elements to her presentation as a "liar". I question her truth, but these techniques are common, natural responses to stress. Please be careful that they're not perceived through your video as manipulation techniques, because that's inaccurate. Stress is why she exhibits these symptoms and people are quick to appropriate tools from these types of videos, to their lived experience and these are not known indicators of lies. 
You hold a lot of sway and credibility, please remember your audience uses your information as guide posts for their own lives and as entertaining as the extreme presentations of opinions are on youtube... you're a healer. Be kind. Whether the accusations are true or not the impact of domestic violence debated in the public arena is a really challenging thing. There are a lot of people living that experience right now. Let's be careful not to make light too much.
author: J Fraser

comment:
The incongruent head nod at 3:10 could have been because she was asked two consecutive Y/N quesitons; she might have been nodding 'yes' to the 2nd question, meanwhile answering 'no' to the 1st question.

While I agree that the eye-wandering, eye-blinking, and licking the lips are weird, and typical signs of deception, it's hard to conclusively determine that she's being deceptive without knowing what her baseline looks like.

However, as the video goes on, it becomes more and more apparent that she's not only a liar, but also a BAD actress!

Derek, I think your analysis of this video is completely accurate. I tried hard to find something I can offer as a counter-argument, but you covered all the bases. Great job!

comment:
Despite the drama, Derek is actually fairly competent at deciphering body language.  I love that he opened showing Amber portraying her ‚Äúheartfelt emotion‚Äù outside the high court.  It is one of her favorite poses, hand over her heart, raising her eyes upward, radiating sincerity and a simple faith in God.  She is an oddly old fashioned actress.  Much of her acting reminds me of the posturing in the silent movies.  It is weirdly hackneyed and rings false.  The deposition was a disaster, but I think that Amber‚Äôs lawyers (the ones who later quit!) rehearsed her heavily and she undoubtedly gave a more polished performance in court.  

Derek kept alluding to the stress involved in lying, but I don‚Äôt think it is stressful for Amber in the conventional sense.  She isn‚Äôt at all bothered by telling a lie, or concerned about the ramifications upon the person she is lying about.  What gets her flustered is not knowing her lines.  Amber‚Äôs portray of emotion is not at all authentic.  I love it when she inserts the occasional tremor in her voice as she bravely perseveres in telling all about how mean her husband was to her.  She is very crafty, yet childlike at the same time.

comment: Using present tense isn't necessarily proof that someone is lying when they claim abuse. Studies suggest that when recounting traumatic events, victims will become so emotionally immersed in the events that they will describe them in present tense. The internet has simply chosen to believe Johnny Depp because he is more likable, even though he clearly has alcohol and substance abuse issues. A more sympathetic internet would agree they are both damaged people who deserve empathy.

comment:
If you were genuinely in court to testify about domestic abuse you suffered, there is no way you‚Äôd eat chocolate on the stand, or indeed anything at all. You‚Äôd be sick to your stomach. You‚Äôd be genuinely distraught. You‚Äôd be staring straight at the lawyers because you would want them to believe you - you‚Äôd use your eyes to convince, steady eye contact, not glancing all over the place. And *not once* would a trace of a smirk cross your face. Your answers would be straightforward and simple, because they would be true.

This woman is a disgrace. Not just for being an abuser herself, but for minimising abuse for other victims, for trying to shame JD and for putting back the cause of belief in domestic violence, which is a real, pervasive and terrible thing for many, many women - and some men. Not as many men though. Mostly it‚Äôs women who suffer behind closed doors. It doesn‚Äôt make the men‚Äôs suffering any less though - and to have this vile creature smirking through her lies about it while claiming to be an advocate for DV victims is just sickening.

I hope justice is done here.

comment:
She looks so guilty. She reminds me of a kid trying to lie to her parents. I have dealt with many narcissists in my life, and she is most definitely one. 

 Being a survivor of abuse myself, this is not something to joke about. How can she so boldly lie and assume she is in the right? That is what a narc does best. She will never admit she‚Äôs wrong, and she‚Äôll lie/squirm/cheat/ and do whatever she has to. She has already convinced herself that she can never take blame.

comment:
She's hilariously bad at lying. It was fecking painful to watch. Her formulating the narrative in her head and constantly speaking in present tense. It reminded me of when me and my friends used to make comedy sketches and we would be on the fly formulating them. "And then I grab your arm and yell in your ear and you look really irritated. Then we start to scuffle.... "
It was bizarre. I have been through traumatic events and when you recount from memory something horrific you don't struggle like she did to remember. You don't wave your arms around and look around and take big pauses, Christ. That shit is fresh and often comes back in flashes for years, forever after it happened. You are haunted by it.

comment: To clarify, libel is anything in a permanent form, slander is anything in a non-permanent form. For example, a gesture. How do you do these videos on an active case without being sued for libel, or having the attorney general for England and Wales breathing down your neck for contempt of court? These technically create a substantial risk of serious prejudice to the trial, but are you using a Section 5 of The Contempt Of Court Act 1981 as a defence? As far as libel goes, are you using absolute privilege as a defence, or honest opinion?

comment:
She's not a bad liar. She's stupid. And entitled.

She never figured she'd be busted for abuse so she never went through what she would say happened. Ppl who know they might be accused go through scenarios of what they might be accused of and construct a whole story. That way when they tell their part, it doesn't show as a lie as much. Really smart ppl who lie do it so often they begin to believe it.

You can tell she wants to say, "yeah I effing hit him! He's an effing baby and always runs away in a fight!" Or whatever she believes about him that justifies, in her mind, her right to hit him. But she can't she has to play the victim so she has to make up the character on the spot.

comment: Just be mindful everyone that 1/10 people with borderline personality disorder do actually end up ending their own lives, and it can be especially risky when a relationship breaks down or they feel rejected/abandoned.  These sorts of behaviours often stem from childhood trauma.  Whilst it doesnt excuse abuse in any way and she does appear to be largely at fault here, I do hope she gets the right psychiatric evaluation and therapy.   She may not have borderline PD, but from listening to the tapes she certainly has emotional dysregulation, impulsivity and insecure attachment which are all a key part of the disorder.

if a woman's behaviour during courtship seems mad, 
seems arbitrary to the point of tyranny, there is a simple purpose to it

vital areas, she then has to gett him to propose, thereby signalling his 
eagerness to begin slaving for her. If he is not already on his knees,

comment:
Acting isn't the same as being caught in a lie. Actors spend a lot of time practicing and studying their characters and motivations and rehearsing with other cast members before being filmed, and even then they're filmed several times doing different takes, changing things slightly to get it right. I just don't fully appreciate people drawing the line between people who are practicing a craft for entertainment and people who are lying in the context of actual life. 

Having said that, the place where acting and lying do come together is psychopathy. Psychopathic people learn to mimic emotions in order to make people believe they really feel them. And a lot of them get really good at it. At least we can probably go ahead and assume that Amber isn't a psychopath. If she were, she wouldn't have stumbled so many times during this interview.

comment: 2:49 The lawyer wasn't objecting to help her lie, necessarily, or to interrupt anything. During a deposition, the deponent's lawyer must object to any procedural problem with a question at the time it's asked, otherwise he can't raise the objection later in court. His complaint about the first question was that it "calls for a legal conclusion" and it was "irrelevant". The first was because Johnny's lawyer asked if Amber "committed an act of domestic violence".  "Domestic violence" is a defined crime that depends on a range of circumstances, and Amber isn't qualified or required to evaluate or conclude whether any given acts meets the elements of the crime. Johnny's lawyer could remedy the problem with her question by asking something like "did you ever punch , kick, or strike Johnny Depp?"  And he claimed the question was "irrelevant" because the case is about her allegation that he did that to her.  So it wasn't "odd" for him to object, or a "red flag", and it wasn't "to interrupt the flow of the questioning". He would be a bad attorney if he didn't say exactly what he did when he did in this clip.

comment: In this case, he's the victim, you don't need a psychological degree to see there's something very wrong with her and her stories. He tried to walk away, to get on with his life but nope, even after wanting a non-disclosure, she couldn't keep quiet as she saw the MeToo movement as a way of garnering more publicity for herself... After she'd sold her Grimm's fairytales to a few different outlets, he got fed up and I don't blame him, he had to live with that, then dealt with being ostracised for something he'd had done to him. I can't even imagine how hard it would be to have people call you shun and ostracise you as she spewed these lies out time and time again. Especially when he knew damn well, he was the one who'd lived what she's trying to sell. Each time she told it, she added in more details, more events to garner further attention and cause him more harm psychologically... I say, sue her arse, I hope she does time for not only what she did to him then perjuring herself time and time again, but using victims to try to further her career and increase her wealth. She's a vile piece of work.

Trial by media + public opinion is dangerous. What if JD did do something but Amber exaggerated? Maybe he didn‚Äôt at all and is in fact, a victim. None of us were there. Only they, the lawyers, and the judge know the truth.

comment: (Eats chocolate)... Pause to chew... Pause to chew... (Begins to finally answer yes that she has hit Depp before)... Her lawyer immediately interjects and starts to talk some BS about how some super light whispering in the crowd is interrupting and ruining everything, then when Depp's lawyer re-asks the same question again to get everyone back on track, the chick's lawyer actually tried to accuse Depp's lawyer (the one asking the friggin questions looking for answers) of being the one who's preventing his client from getting a word in edgewise... LMFAO, really dude? If anything, you sir are the one preventing your client from uttering a complete sentence. Wow, what a jackass her lawyer was.. anyone watching this unfold who has a single pair of functioning brain cells can easily pick up on just how desperate her lawyer is to shield her from having to respond to anything or even acknowledge any of the hard questions, and therefore it doesn't take a rocket scientist to realize that anyone who's being this dodgy is clearly the guilty party with something to hide in the situation. Otherwise, if you knew you were the victim and totally in the right in this kind of situation you would freely answer all questions without hesitation, and you wouldn't need your lawyer to be finding every little opportunity to throw the questioning off the rails and then request time outs for you. This dude might think he is helping his client's cause by using all these delay and deflect tactics, but everyone knows only guilty people need to dodge and deflect as much as her and her lawyer are. If anything he doesn't even realize how much more credibility he's unknowingly giving to Depp's testimony and to his version of events.

comment: I believe Heard has lied about some things but not all of it. There are way too many things that point to JD being a domestic abuser as well. I think he and Amber are both guilty. He admitted to head butting her but claimed it was an " accident." I am not buying it. An accidental head butting sounds absolutely ridiculous. Sounds like gaslighting tactics of a domestic abuser.  One of the first things listed as a warning sign of someone being capable of domestic violence is if they break objects. That in itself is considered violence and is one of the warning signs of a domestic abuser. Psychologists will tell you to steer clear if someone does this in your presence. It is a form of intimidation and is psychologically considered emotional abuse. And normal people don't talk about wanting to drown, burn and fuck someone's dead corpse. It blows my mind that people are defending this behavior from him.  When you take one thing about JD it seems miniscule. But when you start to put all of these things together it begins to paint a completely different picture. There were TONS of stories back in the 90's and 2000's of him being violent. Tons. He has been arrested several times for punching security guards, co workers, photographers... He is violent. You can look it up on court docs and his arrest records going as far back as 1989. And why is Kate Moss so quiet? If memory serves me correctIy he was arrested once for screaming at her in public and another time for trashing a room during a fight. I remember tons of stories of their volatile relationship. They were together for a long time. Why didn't JD's defense attorneys call her as a witness? It's most likely because it would make him look bad. Perhaps he did push her down the stairs? Why didn't she stand up and deny Heard's accusation? Pay very close attention to what is NOT being said. Silence speaks volumes sometimes.

comment:
Hi,
Please can you help to expose the truth about Johnny Depp. There is an audio that can be found on the Motivator Network. This audio has been circulating quietly on Twitter for weeks. In this audio, Depp admits beating Amber, she admits covering her bruises with makeup and she admits being afraid to go to the police, and says to him that she is trying to protect him and that she was afraid he would kill her in his last attack. 
The previous audio was chopped up by his team and stans to make it as detrimental as possible to Heard, but this audio where he admits beating her is NOT BEING COVERED by any mass media.
He has a PR and legal army that he is allegedly paying millions to to hide the truth about his abuse (not saying Heard is completely innocent but some of her behaviour is due to repeated physical abuse by this powerful man and knowing she had no way to ever be believed). He has a long history of violent behavior (with many witnesses to his self-confessed "hellish temper") when he is drunk or on drugs that has been covered up for a long time and given the lengths he will go to to sue and intimidate people, people are afraid to talk about him. Please can you break this story and cover this audio.

To anyone reading this who has been sucked in whole by the Depp machine, please have the decency to listen to the audios before commenting. Thank you.

I love y'all, mask up friends!
